snippet: Visitors to this show at the Monnaie de Paris do not merely look, but have a chance to interact with the art or leave with an object from the exhibition.
abstract: Monnaie de Paris on France’s Left Bank opens exhibition Take Me (I’m Yours) encouraging visitors to take home clothes, placebo pills, postcards and other pieces as way to understand art’s value, distribution and transformation; tangible programming is part of 1,500 year-old museum's mission to become more welcoming and innovative.
lead_paragraph: Visitors to this show at the Monnaie de Paris do not merely look, but have a chance to interact with the art or leave with an object from the exhibition.

headline.print_headline: Stop, Look and Maybe Walk Off With the Art
headline.main: At ‘Take Me (I’m Yours),’ Stop, Look and Walk Off With the Art
